text:
- [Lecturer] Hello, my
name is Sayali Jojan

and I'm a senior analytics
specialist SA at AWS.
In this video, I will be showing you how
to create and publish your product
on AWS Data Exchange also referred as ADX
using Amazon Redshift data share.
For those who are new to Redshift,

Amazon Redshift is a cloud
data warehouse solution
on AWS platform.

RA3 is latest addition
to Redshift's node types.
RA3 node provides managed storage,
which allows customers to scale storage
and compute separately.

These nodes are built
on the AWS Nitro System

and feature high bandwidth
networking and performance.

RA3 nodes support latest
features on Amazon Redshift,
such as data sharing and AQUA.
Redshift's data sharing feature allows you

to share live data
across Redshift clusters
for read purposes.

One of the use cases for
this feature is the ability
to deliver data and analytics as a service
across your organization.

Data producers, also known
as data sharing producers
or data shared producers, are clusters
that you want to share data from.
Data consumers are the clusters

that receive data shares
from producer clusters.

Using the new ADX data
share type on Redshift,

you can now easily license
access to your data sets.
Data providers store the data
on their Amazon Redshift cluster,
and can share specific data objects
as part of their data product.

Users that subscribe to
the data products on ADX,

are added as consumers to the
shared Redshift data share.
Invoices are automatically generated
and payments are centrally collected
and automatically disposed

through AWS Marketplace
Entitlement Service.

In order to add ADX
data shares to products,

you must be a registered
ADX data provider,

and your Redshift cluster
needs to be encrypted.

Next you need to execute the
five steps on this slide,
which I will be showing you in the demo.

So without further delay,
let's move to the AWS console.
Here I have a Redshift cluster
that I've already created for this demo.

Now we will go ahead
and create a data share.
First, let's connect to the database.

It takes a few seconds to
load any existing data shares.
We will be creating one from scratch.
So let's create a share and on this page,
choose AWS Data Exchange data shared type.
Specify a name for your data share.

And you can choose from
any existing databases
that you have on the cluster.

Publicly accessible
should be set to enable.
And now we add data share objects.
You can choose from available schemas,
here I'm choosing demo schema
and I'm opting to share tables
and views from the schema.
Further, I can choose specific tables

or views that I want to
add to this data share.
For the sake of this demo,
I'm adding a single table sales.

Now I will go ahead and
create this data share.
Once the data share is created,
now we go to the data share's tab
from the left navigation console.
And over here are I can see the data share
that we just created.

Now we need to authorize
the status share for ADX.

And with that single
click, it's now authorized.
Just making sure we have the right table.

And now we go to the ADX
console to create the data set
and publish it on ADX.
Here I choose Amazon Redshift data shared

and define my data set
by providing it a name,

and you can also provide a
description for your data set
so that your consumers can see this.

Next we will create a
revision within this dataset.
Now let's add the data share
that we'd created on the Redshift cluster.

So I'm going to choose the
one that we just created
and add it to the dataset.
Last step is to finalize the revision.
And with that you have now created
and published your dataset on ADX,

which you can see under
the owned datasets.
I hope you found this video helpful
and thank you for watching.
